-->

Case doesn't match with the path value of profile and the directory that is automatically created at startup.
For this reason, if the profile script is deployed to the directory that is automatically created at powershell startup, that isn't invoked.
## Steps to reproduce
1. $ rm -rf ~/.config/PowerShell
2. $ ls -lhad ~/.config/PowerShell
   
   > check directory isn't exist.
3. $ powershell
4. PS> exit
5. $ ls -lhad ~/.config/PowerShell
   
   > check directory is created automatically.
6. $ echo "Get-Date" > ~/.config/PowerShell/profile.ps1
7. $ powershell
   
   > check profile.ps1 isn't invoked.
8. PS /home/takai> exit
9. $ mkdir ~/.config/powershell
   
   > create lower case directory.
10. $ mv ~/.config/PowerShell/profile.ps1 ~/.config/powershell/
11. $ powershell
    
    > check profile.ps1 is invoked.
## Expected behavior

One of the following : 
- $profile is set "PowerShell" instead of "powershell"
- create "powershell" directory instead of "PowerShell" at startup

And the profile script which is deployed to the directory that is automatically created at startup is invoked correctly.
## Actual behavior

Directory that is automatically created at startup : `~/.config/PowerShell`
$profile CurrentUserAllHosts path : `~/.config/powershell/profile.ps1`
## Environment data

Commands and outputs are following.

```

takai@ubuntu1604:~$ ls -lhad ~/.config/PowerShell

takai@ubuntu1604:~$ powershell
PowerShell
```
